text: Can we make few orderers in current version fabric (from master)? Or for consensus we need to use Kafka, now?
why? if something going wrong we will not have “orderer"
I never said it should be used in production, it just exists

<@U3DHKV84C> solo is primarily for testing and development - it isn't meant for production use. Kafka is primarily for environments that don't have a need for BFT, and are satisfied by crash fault tolerance, such as a blockchain solution deployed within a single enterprise or where there is a single trusted central authority. We are also working on sbft orderer that will be finalized after the v1.0 release. There will likely be other alternatives developed over time.
<@U0KM61BCP> will we support to migrate the orderer service from Kafka to sbft, since you mentioned the sbft will available AFTER v1.0 release
<@U0NCW1DPX>: <@U0KM61BCP> explained clear, they should be used in different scenarios, I assume it doesn't exist 'Migrate' relation.
<@U0NCW1DPX> I can say that there is no _technical_ impossibility with migrating between consensus types, whether it is supported is another question
Whether it's a practically useful thing to do is also another question.
